triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes game-theoretic models to evaluate and predict stakeholder interactions in construction engineering and management.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: SNA is the quantitative methodology employed to analyze game-theoretic interactions and identify literature trends in CEM research.

triples.name: Conflict resolution
triples.relevance: One of seven key CEM applications where game-theoretic models are applied to resolve disputes among project stakeholders.

triples.name: Negotiation
triples.relevance: Game theory is applied to analyze bargaining and negotiations between construction stakeholders to achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.

triples.name: Auction
triples.relevance: Construction bidding, a major CEM application, utilizes game-theoretic models to understand strategic bidding behavior in auctions.

triples.name: Risk management
triples.relevance: Risk allocation, a key CEM application, applies game-theoretic approaches to distribute project risks among stakeholders optimally.

triples.name: Construction management
triples.relevance: The primary domain of application for the paper's review of game-theoretic models in managing construction projects and stakeholder interactions.
